books.title: Magnificent Obsession
books.author: Lloyd C. Douglas
books.summary: A brain surgeon’s secret obsession is discovered and adopted by the wealthy young man involved in his death.

books.title: The Prisoner of Zenda
books.author: Anthony Hope
books.summary: King Rudolph V of Ruritania is drugged and abducted on the eve of his coronation, and a gentleman on holiday who happens to look like the king has to stop the sinister plot.

books.title: Wonderful Adventures of Mrs. Seacole in Many Lands
books.author: Mary Seacole
books.summary: A British Creole woman provides medical assistance during the Crimean War after her travels around Panama.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: The Gold Bat
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: The boys of Wrykyn School battle to defend their honor against rival sports teams and enemies from within.

books.title: The Importance of Being Earnest
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A comedy skewering Victorian high society.

books.title: Six Characters in Search of an Author
books.author: Luigi Pirandello
books.summary: An absurdist comedy that contrasts illusion with reality, in which six characters arrive on a rehearsal stage filled with actors and demand the chance to speak their lines and act out the story of their lives.

books.title: Master Flea
books.author: E. T. A. Hoffmann
books.summary: A gentleman bachelor gains an epic advantage of tiny proportions in this allegorical, Romantic, fairy-tale novel.

books.title: Mr. Standfast
books.author: John Buchan
books.summary: An army general chases a network of German spies through Scotland, the Swiss Alps, and the First World War’s Western Front.

books.title: The House on the Borderland
books.author: William Hope Hodgson
books.summary: An account of the terrifying metaphysical haunting of a recluse’s secluded home.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: Clouds of Witness
books.author: Dorothy L. Sayers
books.summary: An aristocrat with a passion for detective work has to clear the Duke, his brother, from a charge of murder.

books.title: Democracy and Education
books.author: John Dewey
books.summary: A critical survey of the philosophy and aims of education in a democratic society.

books.title: Orthodoxy
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: G. K. Chesterton’s unique view on Christianity and how all his “solitary and sincere speculations” were ultimately answered by its theology.

books.title: Poems on Various Subjects, Religious and Moral
books.author: Phillis Wheatley
books.summary: Phillis Wheatley’s only published collection of poetry.

books.title: Main Street
books.author: Sinclair Lewis
books.summary: An ambitious young woman chafes against the constraints of small-town America.

books.title: R.U.R.
books.author: Karel Čapek
books.summary: The development of artificial beings in huge quantities to act as workers and soldiers leads to disaster for mankind.

books.title: Jungle Tales of Tarzan
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: A collection of short stories about Tarzan growing up in the jungle.

books.title: Unspoken Sermons
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: George MacDonald presents a set of interlocking sermons designed to shape the perception and life of the Christian disciple.

books.title: The Worst Journey in the World
books.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard
books.summary: The travelogue of a member of Robert Scott’s ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1910.
